intro: Eleutherine subaphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eleutherine, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its strap-shaped, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in a dense, umbellate inflorescence. It is a rhizomatous perennial, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it can be challenging to grow outside its native habitat.
